document.docTitle: Meri conduri Rheims & Jäger 2022, spec. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revalidation of the genus Sadala Simon, 1880 with the description of a new genus of Neotropical huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revalidation of the genus Sadala Simon, 1880 with the description of a new genus of Neotropical huntsman spiders (Araneae, Sparassidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 126–132.
Meri carabobo
spec. nov.
126–129 Male (AMNH, holotype), left palp (126 prolateral, 127 ventral, 128 retrolateral, 129 detail of embolus); 130–132 Female (AMNH, paratype) (130 epigyne, 131 vulva; 132 schematic course of internal duct system). ag—anterior groove; C—conductor; E—embolus; EP—epigynal pocket; ft—first turn of duct system; FD—fertilization duct; GP—glandular projection; LL—lateral lobe; MAB—muscle attachment bands; MS—median septum; PTA—prolateral tibial apophysis; RpP—retro proximal projection of the cymbium; RTA—retrolateral tibial apophysis; SP— spermathecae. Scale lines: 1 mm.

FIGURES 133–137.
Meri carabobo
spec. nov.
133–135 Male (AMNH, holotype), left palp (133 prolateral, 134 ventral, 135 retrolateral); 136–137 Female (AMNH, paratype) (136 epigyne, 137 vulva). Scale lines: 1 mm.

FIGURES 138–144.
Meri conduri
spec. nov.
138–141 Male (MZSP 40750, holotype), left palp (138 prolateral, 139 ventral, 140 retrolateral, 141 detail of embolus); 142–144 Female (IBSP 7368) (142 epigyne, 143 vulva, 144 schematic course of internal duct system). C—conductor; E—embolus; EP—epigynal pocket; ft—first turn of duct system; FD—fertilization duct; GP—glandular projection; LL—lateral lobe; MAB—muscle attachment bands; MS—median septum; mr—membranous region; PTA—prolateral tibial apophysis; RdP—retro dorsal tibial projection; RTA—retrolateral tibial apophysis; SdP—subdistal projection; SP—spermathecae. Scale lines: 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The specific name refers to the “Conduri” people, original inhabitants of the Juruti area and most of the Lower Amazonas region ; noun in apposition.

Diagnosis. Males of
M. conduri
sp. nov.
resemble those of
M. manaos
sp. nov.
( Figs 187–190 ) by the palp with tibia bearing a small triangular retrodorsal projection. They are distinguished from the latter species by the RTA roughly S-shaped (best seen in ventral view) and embolus with short laminar subdistal projection ( Figs 139, 141 ) (RTA triangular and embolus lacking subdistal projection in
M. manaos
spec. nov.
). Females resemble those of
M. trinitatis
comb. nov.
( Figs 269–274 ) by the epigyne with MS roughly hexagonal. They are distinguished from the latter species by the MS with similar length sides and EP opening slightly anterior to posterior margin of MS ( Fig. 142 ) and vulva with GP arising from ducts at first turn and SP spherical with smooth margins ( Fig. 143 ) (anterior side shorter, EP opening at posterior margin, GP arising from ducts close to SP, not at first turn and SP irregular shaped with convoluted margins in
M. trinitatis
comb. nov.
).

Description. Male ( holotype ):
Total length 14.8. Prosoma 6.5 long, 6.1 wide. Opisthosoma 8.2 long, 4.9 wide. Eyes: diameters: 0.47, 0.41, 0.30, 0.39; interdistances: 0.30, 0.12, 0.53, 0.60, 0.35, 0.20. Legs: I: 36.3 (10.0, 3.6, 9.7, 10.5, 2.5); II: 38.2 (10.3, 3.6, 10.7, 11.0, 2.6); III: 27.0 (8.4, 2.7, 6.9, 7.1, 1.9); IV: 30.6 (9.2, 2.7, 7.9, 8.7, 2.1). Spination follows the generic pattern except patella IV: p1, r1; metatarsus IV: r1-1-2. Palp: PTA triangular, distally rounded, slightly wider than long; subtegulum visible between 9 and 11 o’clock in ventral view; conductor widest at base, distally fanned; embolus slightly depressed prolaterally, with large membranous region ( Fig. 100 , 138–141 , 145–147 ).

Female (UFMG 9956, paratype ):
Total length 13.9. Prosoma 6.0 long, 5.4 wide. Opisthosoma 7.5 long, 4.8 wide. Eyes: diameters: 0.44, 0.39, 0.30, 0.34; interdistances: 0.30, 0.22, 0.60, 0.60, 0.35, 0.22. Legs: I: 24.9 (7.2, 3.0, 6.2, 6.6, 1.9); II: 26.5 (7.8, 3.0, 6.9, 6.9, 1.9); III: 19.0 (6.0, 2.2, 4.6, 4.7, 1.5); IV: 6.9, 2.2, 5.3, 5.2, 1.7). Spination follows the generic pattern except patellae I–III: p1. Epigyne: EF as wide as long; MAB conspicuous, partly embedded in EF; EP triangular, as wide as long; LL touching posteriorly ( Figs 142 , 149 ). Vulva: internal ducts with FW mediad; GP conical, longer than wide, arising from ducts at first turn, anteriad; FD anteriad ( Figs 143–144 , 149 ).

Variation. Males (n = 10): total length 11.0–15.1; prosoma length 5.0–6.7; femur I length 7.9–11.0. Females (n = 10): total length 14.8–20.8; prosoma length 6.3–7.5; femur I length 8.0–9.1. Coloration pattern in males and females can be generally darker with opisthosoma showing no distinct pattern, except lighter heart mark.
Distribution. Central and southernAmazonia(Brazilian states ofAmazonas, Pará , Acre and Rondônia ) ( Fig.318 ).
